snippet: Concerned about the stagnating economy, China’s leaders have moved to shore up growth by cutting interest rates and announcing bold spending packages in recent months.
abstract: China's official factory purchasing managers' index slipped to 50.1 points in July, from 50.2 points in June and the lowest figure in eight months.
lead_paragraph: Concerned about the stagnating economy, China’s leaders have moved to shore up growth by cutting interest rates and announcing bold spending packages in recent months.

headline.seo: China’s Economy Slows as Exports and New Orders Decline
headline.main: In China, Manufacturing Growth Still Slumps
headline.print_headline: Manufacturing Still Grows in China, but More Slowly
